thread.title: U.S. Representative Hartzler launches anti-drug initiative
thread.title_full: U.S. Representative Hartzler launches anti-drug initiative

title: U.S. Representative Hartzler launches anti-drug initiative
text:
Feds sending Missouri $36.7 million to help crime victims 
Today, Representative Hartzler unveiled the anti-drug initiative, “Take Back the District.” Its purpose is to raise awareness of the drug problem and spur action to combat substance abuse and addiction. She says the program will accomplish its goal by bringing together law enforcement, parents, school officials, community leaders, and citizens. 
In a news release today, Hartzler said, “As a former teacher who was also a co-director of a program for at-risk teens, I have seen the devastation drugs can cause in the lives of our youth, their families, and our communities,” Hartzler asserted. “I am saddened to see that the scourge of drugs continues to devastate too many lives in our counties. This has got to stop. It’s time to unite and take action against this menace to set a new path for individuals and families in our district—one that is drug-free.” 
Congresswoman Hartzler has scheduled the start of the “Take Back the District” anti-drug initiative with a conference, scheduled for October 19th, 2015, at Camp CUMCITO in Warsaw, Missouri. It is open to the public. 
Representative Hartzler will be our guest for “This Week,” Friday on ABC 17 News at 6:30 on KMIZ, and on ABC 17 News at 9:00 on FOX 22, KQFX.
